parameter.name: expirationPolicy
parameter.description: Configures the minimum amount of time that a dynamic configuration instance can remain idle before the runtime considers it eligible for expiration. This does not mean that the platform will expire the instance at the exact moment that it becomes eligible. The runtime will actually purge the instances when it sees it fit.

parameter.name: expirationPolicy
parameter.description: Configures the minimum amount of time that a dynamic configuration instance can remain idle before the runtime considers it eligible for expiration. This does not mean that the platform will expire the instance at the exact moment that it becomes eligible. The runtime will actually purge the instances when it sees it fit.

parameter.name: reconnection
parameter.description: When the application is deployed, a connectivity test is performed on all connectors. If set to true, deployment will fail if the test doesn't pass after exhausting the associated reconnection strategy

parameter.name: reconnection
parameter.description: When the application is deployed, a connectivity test is performed on all connectors. If set to true, deployment will fail if the test doesn't pass after exhausting the associated reconnection strategy

parameter.name: reconnection
parameter.description: When the application is deployed, a connectivity test is performed on all connectors. If set to true, deployment will fail if the test doesn't pass after exhausting the associated reconnection strategy

operation.name: batchDeleteItem
operation.description: The BatchDeleteItem operation deletes multiple items in one or more tables.

parameter.name: requestDeleteItems
parameter.description: One or more items to delete from the table.

parameter.name: target
parameter.description: The name of a variable on which the operation's output will be placed

parameter.name: targetValue
parameter.description: An expression that will be evaluated against the operation's output and the outcome of that expression will be stored in the target variable

parameter.name: reconnectionStrategy
parameter.description: A retry strategy in case of connectivity errors

operation.name: batchGetItem
operation.description: The BatchGetItem operation returns the attributes of one or more items from one or more tables. You identify requested items by primary key.

parameter.name: requestItems
parameter.description: A map of one or more table names and, for each table, a map that describes one or more items to retrieve from that table.

parameter.name: returnConsumedCapacity
parameter.description: Determines the level of detail about provisioned throughput consumption that is returned in the response.

parameter.name: target
parameter.description: The name of a variable on which the operation's output will be placed

parameter.name: targetValue
parameter.description: An expression that will be evaluated against the operation's output and the outcome of that expression will be stored in the target variable

parameter.name: reconnectionStrategy
parameter.description: A retry strategy in case of connectivity errors

operation.name: batchPutItem
operation.description: The BatchPutItem operation puts multiple items in one or more tables.

parameter.name: requestPutItems
parameter.description: One or more items to insert into table.

parameter.name: target
parameter.description: The name of a variable on which the operation's output will be placed

parameter.name: targetValue
parameter.description: An expression that will be evaluated against the operation's output and the outcome of that expression will be stored in the target variable

parameter.name: reconnectionStrategy
parameter.description: A retry strategy in case of connectivity errors

operation.name: createTable
operation.description: The CreateTable operation adds a new table to your account. In an AWS account, table names must be unique within each region.

parameter.name: tableName
parameter.description: The name of the table to create.

parameter.name: attributeDefinitions
parameter.description: An array of attributes that describe the key schema for the table and indexes.

parameter.name: keySchemas
parameter.description: Specifies the attributes that make up the primary key for a table or an index.

parameter.name: readCapacityUnits
parameter.description: The maximum number of strongly consistent reads consumed per second before DynamoDB returns a ThrottlingException.

parameter.name: writeCapacityUnits
parameter.description: The maximum number of writes consumed per second before DynamoDB returns a ThrottlingException.

parameter.name: globalSecondaryIndexes
parameter.description: One or more global secondary indexes (the maximum is five) to be created on the table.

parameter.name: localSecondaryIndexes
parameter.description: One or more local secondary indexes (the maximum is five) to be created on the table.

parameter.name: streamViewType
parameter.description: When an item in the table is modified, StreamViewType determines what information is written to the table's stream.

parameter.name: streamEnabled
parameter.description: Indicates whether to enable Streams (true) or disable Streams (false).

parameter.name: target
parameter.description: The name of a variable on which the operation's output will be placed

parameter.name: targetValue
parameter.description: An expression that will be evaluated against the operation's output and the outcome of that expression will be stored in the target variable

parameter.name: reconnectionStrategy
parameter.description: A retry strategy in case of connectivity errors

operation.name: deleteItem
operation.description: Deletes a single item in a table by primary key.

parameter.name: tableName
parameter.description: Table name.

parameter.name: primarykey
parameter.description: Primary key name and value map.

parameter.name: target
parameter.description: The name of a variable on which the operation's output will be placed

parameter.name: targetValue
parameter.description: An expression that will be evaluated against the operation's output and the outcome of that expression will be stored in the target variable

parameter.name: reconnectionStrategy
parameter.description: A retry strategy in case of connectivity errors

operation.name: deleteTable
operation.description: The DeleteTable operation deletes a table and all of its items.

parameter.name: tableName
parameter.description: The name of the table to delete.

parameter.name: target
parameter.description: The name of a variable on which the operation's output will be placed

parameter.name: targetValue
parameter.description: An expression that will be evaluated against the operation's output and the outcome of that expression will be stored in the target variable

parameter.name: reconnectionStrategy
parameter.description: A retry strategy in case of connectivity errors

operation.name: describeTable
operation.description: Returns information about the table, including the current status of the table, when it was created, the primary key schema, and any indexes on the table.

parameter.name: tableName
parameter.description: The name of the table to describe.

parameter.name: target
parameter.description: The name of a variable on which the operation's output will be placed

parameter.name: targetValue
parameter.description: An expression that will be evaluated against the operation's output and the outcome of that expression will be stored in the target variable

parameter.name: reconnectionStrategy
parameter.description: A retry strategy in case of connectivity errors

operation.name: getItem
operation.description: The GetItem operation returns a set of attributes for the item with the given primary key.

parameter.name: tableName
parameter.description: The name of the table containing the requested item.

parameter.name: key
parameter.description: A map of attribute names to AttributeValue objects, representing the primary key of the item to retrieve.

parameter.name: attributesToGets
parameter.description: This is a legacy parameter. Use ProjectionExpression instead.

parameter.name: consistentRead
parameter.description: Determines the read consistency model: If set to true, then the operation uses strongly consistent reads; otherwise, the operation uses eventually consistent reads.

parameter.name: expressionAttributeNames
parameter.description: One or more substitution tokens for attribute names in an expression. The following are some use cases for using ExpressionAttributeNames:

parameter.name: projectionExpression
parameter.description: A string that identifies one or more attributes to retrieve from the table.

parameter.name: returnConsumedCapacity
parameter.description: Determines the level of detail about provisioned throughput consumption returned in the response.

parameter.name: target
parameter.description: The name of a variable on which the operation's output will be placed

parameter.name: targetValue
parameter.description: An expression that will be evaluated against the operation's output and the outcome of that expression will be stored in the target variable

parameter.name: reconnectionStrategy
parameter.description: A retry strategy in case of connectivity errors

operation.name: listTables
operation.description: Returns an array of table names associated with the current account and endpoint.

parameter.name: exclusiveStartTableName
parameter.description: The first table name that this operation will evaluate. Use the value that was returned for LastEvaluatedTableName in a previous operation.

parameter.name: limit
parameter.description: A maximum number of table names to return. If this parameter is not specified, the limit is 100.

parameter.name: target
parameter.description: The name of a variable on which the operation's output will be placed

parameter.name: targetValue
parameter.description: An expression that will be evaluated against the operation's output and the outcome of that expression will be stored in the target variable

parameter.name: reconnectionStrategy
parameter.description: A retry strategy in case of connectivity errors

operation.name: putItem
operation.description: Creates a new item, or replaces an old item with a new item. If an item that has the same primary key as the new item already exists in the specified table, the new item replaces the existing item.

parameter.name: tableName
parameter.description: Table name.

parameter.name: item
parameter.description: Item to be inserted.

parameter.name: target
parameter.description: The name of a variable on which the operation's output will be placed

parameter.name: targetValue
parameter.description: An expression that will be evaluated against the operation's output and the outcome of that expression will be stored in the target variable

parameter.name: reconnectionStrategy
parameter.description: A retry strategy in case of connectivity errors

operation.name: query
operation.description: The Query operation finds items based on primary key values. You can query any table or secondary index that has a composite primary key (a partition key and a sort key).

parameter.name: keyConditionExpression
parameter.description: The condition that specifies the key values for items to be retrieved by the Query action.

parameter.name: keyConditions
parameter.description: This is a legacy parameter. Use KeyConditionExpression instead.

parameter.name: scanIndexForward
parameter.description: Specifies the order for index traversal: If true (default), the traversal is performed in ascending order; if false, the traversal is performed in descending order.

parameter.name: select
parameter.description: The attributes to be returned in the result.

parameter.name: target
parameter.description: The name of a variable on which the operation's output will be placed

parameter.name: targetValue
parameter.description: An expression that will be evaluated against the operation's output and the outcome of that expression will be stored in the target variable

parameter.name: reconnectionStrategy
parameter.description: A retry strategy in case of connectivity errors

operation.name: scan
operation.description: The Scan operation returns one or more items and item attributes by accessing every item in a table or secondary index. To have DynamoDB return fewer items, you can provide a FilterExpression operation.

parameter.name: segment
parameter.description: For a parallel Scan request, Segment identifies an individual segment to be scanned by an application worker.

parameter.name: select
parameter.description: The attributes to be returned in the result.

parameter.name: totalSegments
parameter.description: For a parallel Scan request, TotalSegments represents the total number of segments into which the Scan operation is divided.

parameter.name: target
parameter.description: The name of a variable on which the operation's output will be placed

parameter.name: targetValue
parameter.description: An expression that will be evaluated against the operation's output and the outcome of that expression will be stored in the target variable

parameter.name: reconnectionStrategy
parameter.description: A retry strategy in case of connectivity errors

operation.name: updateItem
operation.description: Edits an existing item's attributes, or adds a new item to the table if it does not already exist.

parameter.name: tableName
parameter.description: Table name.

parameter.name: key
parameter.description: Primary key.

parameter.name: returnConsumedCapacity
parameter.description: Determines the level of detail about provisioned throughput consumption that is returned in the response.

parameter.name: returnItemCollectionMetrics
parameter.description: Determines whether item collection metrics are returned.

parameter.name: returnValues
parameter.description: Use if you want to get the item attributes as they appear before or after they are updated.

parameter.name: updateExpression
parameter.description: An expression that defines one or more attributes to be updated, the action to be performed on them, and new value(s) for them.

parameter.name: attributeUpdates
parameter.description: This is a legacy parameter. Use updateExpression instead.

parameter.name: expected
parameter.description: This is a legacy parameter. Use conditionExpression instead.

parameter.name: target
parameter.description: The name of a variable on which the operation's output will be placed

parameter.name: targetValue
parameter.description: An expression that will be evaluated against the operation's output and the outcome of that expression will be stored in the target variable

parameter.name: reconnectionStrategy
parameter.description: A retry strategy in case of connectivity errors

operation.name: updateTable
operation.description: Modifies the provisioned throughput settings, global secondary indexes, or DynamoDB Streams settings for a given table.

parameter.name: tableName
parameter.description: The name of the table to update.

parameter.name: attributeDefinitions
parameter.description: An array of attributes that describe the key schema for the table and indexes. If you are adding a new global secondary index to the table, AttributeDefinitions must include the key elements of the new index.

parameter.name: readCapacityUnits
parameter.description: The maximum number of strongly consistent reads consumed per second before DynamoDB returns a ThrottlingException.

parameter.name: writeCapacityUnits
parameter.description: The maximum number of writes consumed per second before DynamoDB returns a ThrottlingException.

parameter.name: globalSecondaryIndexUpdates
parameter.description: An array of one or more global secondary indexes for the table.

parameter.name: streamViewType
parameter.description: When an item in the table is modified, StreamViewType determines what information is written to the stream for this table.

parameter.name: streamEnabled
parameter.description: Indicates whether DynamoDB Streams is enabled (true) or disabled (false) on the table.

parameter.name: target
parameter.description: The name of a variable on which the operation's output will be placed

parameter.name: targetValue
parameter.description: An expression that will be evaluated against the operation's output and the outcome of that expression will be stored in the target variable

parameter.name: reconnectionStrategy
parameter.description: A retry strategy in case of connectivity errors
